stimulusHtml:
Nostri tamen, quod neque ordines servare neque firmiter insistere neque signa
 subsequi poterant atque alius alia ex navi quibuscumque signis occurrerat se
 adgregabat, magnopere perturbabantur; hostes vero, notis omnibus vadis, ubi ex
 litore aliquos singulares ex navi egredientes conspexerant, incitatis equis impeditos
5adoriebantur, plures paucos circumsistebant, alii ab latere aperto in universos tela
 coiciebant. Quod cum animadvertisset Caesar, scaphas longarum navium, item
 speculatoria navigia militibus compleri iussit, et quos laborantes conspexerat, his
 subsidia submittebat.

Bellum Gallicum 4. 26

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. Briefly describe the object that each legion carried to differentiate itself from other legions?

2. To whom or what does se (line 2) refer?

3. Identify the grammatical construction of notis omnibus vadis (line 3).

4. In lines 1-3 (Nostri . . . perturbabantur), which three Latin words can be translated “they were able to hold their battle lines”?

5. Which Latin word in this passage is the subject of conspexerant (line 4) ?

6. In lines 3-6 (hostes . . . coiciebant), which three Latin words indicate that the Roman soldiers found themselves outnumbered and surrounded?

7. In lines 6-8 (Quod . . . submittebat), (A) identify the subjunctive verb and (B) explain why it is in the subjunctive mood.

8. In lines 6-8 (Quod . . . submittebat), which one Latin word indicates that some Roman soldiers were having difficulty in battle?

9. What are the case and use of his (line 7) ?
